intro: Seseli hippomarathrum subsp. hippomarathrum, commonly known as the horse-marathrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It has finely divided, feathery leaves that are often aromatic. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for certain pollinators and its role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
